input_sentence: before overtaking vehicle in front ego shall make sure that other vehicle in behind did not already started to overtake the ego.

atomic_propositions.description: Vehicle behind started to overtake ego

temporal_relations.description: Before ego overtakes front vehicle, ensure behind vehicle did not already start overtaking ego

metric_constraints.description: Check that behind vehicle did not start overtaking at any point in the past before ego's overtaking

lexicon.behind_started_overtake: vehicle behind started to overtake ego

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_front_vehicle → front_vehicle  
   - obj_behind_vehicle → behind_vehicle

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for atomic propositions:
   - ap_1: overtake(ego, front_vehicle)
   - ap_2: overtake(behind_vehicle, ego)
   - ap_3: started_overtake(behind_vehicle, ego)

3. Analyze temporal relations and metric constraints:
   - "past_precondition": antecedent=ap_1, consequent=~ap_3
   - "past_window": [0,∞) indicates checking entire past
   - This maps to past-time operator O (once in the past)

4. Construct implication: overtake(ego, front_vehicle) -> ~O(started_overtake(behind_vehicle, ego))

5. Apply global property "Always": G(...)

Final MTL Formula:
G(overtake(ego, front_vehicle) -> ~O(started_overtake(behind_vehicle, ego)))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_front_vehicle → front_vehicle  
   - obj_behind_vehicle → behind_vehicle

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for atomic propositions:
   - ap_1: overtake(ego, front_vehicle)
   - ap_2: overtake(behind_vehicle, ego)
   - ap_3: started_overtake(behind_vehicle, ego)

3. Analyze temporal relations and metric constraints:
   - "past_precondition": antecedent=ap_1, consequent=~ap_3
   - "past_window": [0,∞) indicates checking entire past
   - This maps to past-time operator O (once in the past)

4. Construct implication: overtake(ego, front_vehicle) -> ~O(started_overtake(behind_vehicle, ego))

5. Apply global property "Always": G(...)

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula uses the global operator `G`, meaning "Always" or "Globally"
- The main structure is an implication `->` between two parts
- Left side: `overtake(ego, front_vehicle)` - ego overtakes the front vehicle
- Right side: `~O(started_overtake(behind_vehicle, ego))` - negation of "Once in the past, the behind vehicle started to overtake ego"
- The past-time operator `O` means "Once in the past" (unbounded past occurrence)
- The negation `~` applied to `O(...)` means "it is not the case that once in the past..."
- Therefore, `~O(started_overtake(behind_vehicle, ego))` means "the behind vehicle never started to overtake ego in the past"
- The implication structure means "if left side is true, then right side must be true"

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle overtakes the vehicle in front, then the vehicle behind must never have started to overtake the ego vehicle in the past.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the ego vehicle overtakes the vehicle in front, then the vehicle behind must never have started to overtake the ego vehicle in the past.

- The past-time operator `O` means "Once in the past" (unbounded past occurrence)
- The negation `~` applied to `O(...)` means "it is not the case that once in the past..."
- Therefore, `~O(started_overtake(behind_vehicle, ego))` means "the behind vehicle never started to overtake ego in the past"
- The implication structure means "if left side is true, then right side must be true"

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
